FileFormat.FormatDescription: The AGS Data Format was created in 1991 by the Association of Geotechnical and Geoenvironmental Specialists, as a way of transferring data between different organisations in the geotechnical/geoenvironmental industry. It provides a way of exchanging data that is independent of software/ hardware and operating system, and to a consistent standard.
FileFormat.ProvenanceName: AGS / Association of Geotechnical and Geoenvironmental Specialists
FileFormat.ProvenanceDescription: v.120- Removed excess variable marker from signature, updated description and updated version number. Submitted by Ross Spencer as part of PRONOM Research Week v.121: removed comma from file format version field. Submitted by Preservica.

Developers.OrganisationName: Association of Geotechnical and Geoenvironmental Specialists
Developers.DeveloperCompoundName: AGS / Association of Geotechnical and Geoenvironmental Specialists

InternalSignature.SignatureNote: Offset 0-4 from beginning of file, magic bytes: "(GROUP|**PROJ)"*“{0-1}PROJ_ID",{0-1}("PROJ_NAME",”|"PROJ_AGS",")*“{0-1}ABBR_HDNG",”{0-1}ABBR_CODE","
